column4: (according to the guide, it should be at "Applications -> Accessories -> Archive Manager", but it isn't.
perhaps the guide is a bit off or the menus have changed.  look around.
I definitely have "Archive Manager" installed, but it's just not on the menu.
and you installed it with apt-get?
what do you mean?  you bought a machine with linux already on it?
i.e. it got installed along with Dapper 6.06
that's not preinstalled, that just means it's part of the default install set.  effectively the answer to my question is yes.  sounds like a dapper bug.
before someone got their eye poked out ;)
I think he just wants to separate iptables info from all other info
you mean like so? -> "grep rc .bash_history". nothing interesting, why?
